Name: Kate von Roeder ("Riot Damiya")
Description:
Kate died after posting a suicide note to Facebook.

> Kate von Roeder purchased a shotgun last week and began posting cryptic countdowns to her Facebook page, and on Thursday she followed through with plans she said had been made for a long time.
>
> This week, the California woman posted on Facebook a long suicide note before taking her life. In the note, she explained that pressures of living as a trans woman.
>
> In the note, von Roeder explained that transitioning was too difficult, writing, “I shouldn’t have done it. Not because I’m not trans, but because I didn’t have a fraction of the personal strength to succeed at it, unlike some of the amazing trans people I’ve been privileged to know.”
>
> The note garnered immediate responses from Facebook friends, who pleaded with Kate to call a suicide hotline or respond to their calls. But within four hours of posting the note on Facebook, police confirmed that Kate von Roeder had committed suicide.

Kate was a tech analyst at Riot Games and was a prominent member of the League of Legends community.

Her death was not recorded on the TDoR 2015 memorial list released by Transgender Europe (TGEU) in November 2015. Her Facebook and Twitter profiles are https://www.facebook.com/kvonroeder and https://twitter.com/itsdamiya respectively.

Name: Aniya "Asia" Parker
Description:
Aniya was shot in the head during a robbery. She died in hospital.

> Authorities in Los Angeles are offering a $50,000 (â‚¬39,000) for information about the 2 October murder of a transgender woman.
> 
> Earlier this month, 47-year-old Aniya Parker was shot in the head trying to escape from three men near Kenmore and Melrose Avenues.
> 
> According to KTLA 5, a local news station, security video from local businesses shows the victim and suspects in a dispute.
> 
> Parker runs away but is chased by one of the men, who shoots at her. When officers arrived to the scene, she was discovered with a gunshot wound to the head. Parker was pronounced dead at hospital.
> 
> ‘From what we’ve been told by witnesses, it appears … that it may be a robbery gone bad,’ LAPD police Lt. Joe Losorelli said, according to KTLA.

Name: Gull dos Santos
Description:
Gull was shot in the face while walking down the high street. Her attackers fled.

> A Brazilian transgender woman was murdered last week by three shots to the face.
> 
> Gull dos Santos, 35, was killed on Wednesday while walking down on a high street in Rio Largo municipality, Alagoas province.
>
>According to police, two men approached the victim on a motorcycle, fired several shots and fled before they could be identified. dos Santos died on the spot.
>
> Although dos Santos was killed on a busy thoroughfare, witnesses did not pass any useful information to police except that more than one man participated in the crime.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia

Name: Mayang Prasetyo
Description:
Mayang was killed, dismembered and cooked by her boyfriend Marcus Volke, 27. 

When police officers arrived and found him cooking parts of her body he slashed his own throat before jumping the balcony fence and fleeing. His body was found inside an industrial bin.

> A police officer who first responded to a gruesome murder-suicide in Brisbane where a man was cooking the remains of his girlfriend before fleeing has told a coronial inquest he initially thought it was a "sick prank".
> 
> Brisbane chef Marcus Volke, 27, dismembered and cooked the remains of his transgender partner Mayang Prasetyo, 27, at their Teneriffe unit in inner-city Brisbane in October 2014.

Mayang was a migrant from Bali, Indonesia. 

TvT project: ABC News 07.10.2014 & The Advocate 27.10.2014 & The Guardian 08.10.2014

Name: Jennifer Laude
Description:
Jennifer was choked and eventually died of asphyxiation by drowning. Her death became a news sensation because the alleged suspect was a US Marine who was participating in a regular military exercise under the Visiting Forces Agreement. US Marine Lance Corporal Joseph Scott Pemberton was convicted of her murder and sentenced to 6 to 12 years in prison. > A US Marine was found guilty of killing a transgender woman in the Philippines on Tuesday and sentenced to six to 12 years in prison, closing a case that has reignited debate about the American military’s presence in its former colony. > > The Olongapo City regional trial court also ordered Lance Corporal Joseph Scott Pemberton to pay more than 4.5 million pesos ($95,350) to the family of Jennifer Laude, who was found dead last year in a hotel outside a former US navy base northwest of Manila. Pemberton had been charged with murder, but was convicted of the lesser offense of homicide, which does not require malicious intent. In 2018 the documentary "Call Her Ganda" was released about her case. In early September 2020, Pemberton was pardoned by Duterte, the Philippine President. He was deported back to the United States in August 2022. > On Monday, just days after a Filipina court stunned the world by ordering the early release of former U.S. Marine Lance Cpl. Joseph Scott Pemberton, President Duterte pardoned the convicted killer of transgender woman Jennifer Laude. > > The Department of Foreign Affairs and the U.S. Embassy did not immediately respond to questions by the Washington Post on whether the pardon had been requested by the U.S. government. > > **Opinion: This outrageous injustice was undoubtedly facilitated by loser Trump hoping to pander to his right-wing trans hating extremist base during the election year.** > > Following his partying on board his ship the smirking criminal proudly displayed his arrogance in the 2014 mug shot further enraging the LGBT worldwide community. We wanted to believe time would wipe that smirk off his face, but we were wrong.

We will never forgive Duterte for pardoning his fellow murderer Pemberton.

This is a direct attack not just to Jennifer & her family but to every trans person & every victim of our corrupt & unequal “justice” system.#KeepPembertonInJail#JusticeForJenniferLaude#OustDuterte pic.twitter.com/qmHv0MNSXM

— UP Babaylan #SOGIEEqualityNow (@upbabaylan) September 7, 2020
Jennifer deserved so much better than this. Name: Sara dos Prazeres de Jesus
Description:
Sara was shot by two men on a bicycle. She was reportedly the third trans woman killed in the same street.

> A [trans woman] was killed around 8 pm, on Sunday night (12), in Camaçari. [Deadname] dos Prazeres de Jesus, 27, known as Sara, was a resident of Dias D'Ávila, and was killed on Rua Parque Central, a crossroads between Avenida Radial C and B, a place known as a meeting point for transvestites and their clients. Witnesses claim that this is the third [trans woman] killed in this street where they do the programs.
>
> According to police information, the victim was accompanied by other [trans women] when she was approached by two men who were on a bicycle and shot them. “Sara” died at the scene.
>
> Colleagues of the victim believe that the crime is a case of homophobia. “They killed for the simple pleasure of killing, out of sheer malice”, complains one of them.

Name: Mary Joy Anonuevo
Description:
Mary's body was found inside the bar she owned in Tayabas. She had been stabbed 33 times, strangled and robbed.

> MARY JOY ANONUEVO, a transpinay who owned a bar in Tayabas, Quezon was brutally murdered and was discovered dead inside her establishment with several stab wounds all over her body yesterday early morning. People who reported this to me said that she was also strangled to death. Witnesses say that the crime might have happened after an altercation between Mary, the bar owner and the partner of one of the bar's waitresses. Mary had fired the waitress due to bad performance and once unemployed, she and her partner got into some financial problems which led to Mary being murdered by the waitress' partner. I was also told that the victim was robbed of money and other valuables. No clear report yet as to the whereabouts of the suspect. The LGBT group of Tayabas is currently coordinating efforts on this case. Ms. Anonuevo had just celebrated her birthday last October 15."
> 
> I am calling the attention of the Philippine National Police-Tayabas,National Bureau of Investigation in Quezon to please have an in-depth investigation so that the perpetrator is apprehended without further delay.
> 
> Condolences to the bereaved family and to our dear trans sisters in Tayabas, Quezon, we share your loss and your grief.

TvT partner organization: STRAP

Name: Ashley Sherman
Description:
Ashley's body was discovered by a police officer making a traffic stop in the area. She had been shot in the head.

> The body of Ashley (nee Tajshon) Sherman was discovered on the east side of Indianapolis on Sunday evening by a police officer who was making a traffic stop in the area. Ashley was a black trans woman who identified as female according to family members, and called herself Ashley according to co-workers. She had been the victim of numerous cases of harassment and abuse, and was a runaway at age 12. Police later updated their reports with the information that Ashley had been shot in the head. Neighbors in the Tudor Park Condominiums report hearing a shot around midnight that evening.
> 
> Initial coverage of Ashley Sherman’s death was complicated by the police and local media mis-gendering her as male after initially identifying her as female, and mis-naming her as her birth name instead of her chosen name. Misreporting trans women’s murders by mis-gendering has been linked to problems with tracking murders of trans women nationwide and hampered police investigations of those murders. Mis-naming murder victims contributes to lack of police evidence as they attempt to speak to friends who might have known the victim by their chosen name but not their birth name.
> 
> GLAAD’s guidelines on trans people call for media to correctly identify and name trans people in news stories by their chosen names and gender markers.

TvT project: IndyStar 28.10.2014 & The advocate 30.10.2014

http://commonplacebook.com/current-events/glbt-issues/another-black-trans-woman-murdered-mis-gendered-mis-named-in-indianapolis/

Name: Darinka Ivonnet
Description:
Darinka died after a cosmetic filler injection.

> A young Bolivian [trans woman] identified as Darinka Ivonnet (24) was found dead on Friday in her room in Iquique, after complications arising from the injection of industrial silicone in her legs.
>
> According to information from the PDI, the young woman whose real name was [deadname] Crespo Cáceres was at least 36 hours earlier, who worked in the sex trade in the city and whose body was found on October 28.
>
> The head of the Homicide Brigade, Commissioner Paulo Villanueva, added that they were the same friends who gave notice to the police when they did not know about her, so the detectives arrived at the girl's home where they found the incident.
>
> "She did not present injuries attributable to third parties and most likely died of a heart attack," said the commissioner.

Darinka's death was not recorded on the TDoR 2015 memorial list released by Transgender Europe (TGEU) in November 2015.
